ace_sentences: The graph shows for each age group how strongly people believe that the world is getting better.
Indonesia is on the right side and on the top of the graph.
In Indonesia, people who are 15-24 years old think that the world is getting better.
In Indonesia, people who are 40+ years old think that the world is getting better.
In some countries, people who are 15-24 years old strongly think that the world is getting better.
In these countries, people who are 40+ years old think that the world is not getting better.
I wonder why this difference is drastic.
I am part of a generation.
People in my generation expect that the younger generation helps the world.
People in the younger generation should help the world.
If each generation helps the world, then people in each generation will think that the world is getting better.
